Package sample.view_controller

Class AppointmentsController

  • java.lang.Object
    • sample.view_controller.AppointmentsController
  • public class AppointmentsController
extends java.lang.Object
    This class define the view and behaviors of the appointmentsView.FXML and the users interactions with the appointmentView user interface.
    Author:
    Tchaikousky Thomas

      • AppointmentsController

        public AppointmentsController()

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        private void initialize()
        This method sets the scene's fields before the scene is loaded. The labels are set based on the user's default locale. Lambdas are used to filter through the appointments list and create new dynamic weekly and monthly lists. Lambdas are used again to set the cell factories of the appointment table view table columns.

      • handleDeleteButton

        void handleDeleteButton​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
                 throws java.sql.SQLException,
                        java.io.IOException
        This method determines what action to take when the delete button is pressed. An alert is displayed to confirm the users intent of deleting an appointment. If the user confirms the delete, then another alert is displayed to confirm to the user what was deleted.
        Parameters:
        event - The action event.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException
        java.io.IOException

      • handleMonthlyRadioButton

        void handleMonthlyRadioButton()
        This method determines what action to take when the monthly RadioButton is selected. If the monthly RadioButton is selected, then the 'weekly' and 'all' RadioButtons are automatically deselected.

      • handleWeeklyRadioButton

        void handleWeeklyRadioButton()
        This method determines what action to take when the weekly RadioButton is selected. If the weekly RadioButton is selected, then the 'monthly' and 'all' RadioButtons are automatically deselected.

      • handleAllRadioButton

        private void handleAllRadioButton()
        This method determines what action to take when the all RadioButton is selected. If the all RadioButton is selected, then the 'weekly' and 'monthly' RadioButtons are automatically deselected.

      • handleNewButton

        void handleNewButton​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
        This method determines what action to take when the new button is pressed. The scene is redirected to addAppointmentView.fxml upon completeion of this method.
        Parameters:
        event - The action event.

      • handleUpdateButton

        void handleUpdateButton​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
                 throws java.sql.SQLException
        This method determines what action to take when the update button is pressed. The scene is redirected to updateAppointmentView.fxml upon the completion of this method. The updateAppointmentView scene is set from the selected appointment in the appointments tableView.
        Parameters:
        event - The action event.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • handleAppointmentsButton

        private void handleAppointmentsButton​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
        This method handles the action taken after pressing the appointments button. The appointmentsView.fxml is loaded
        Parameters:
        event - The action event.

      • handleCustomersButton

        private void handleCustomersButton​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
        This method handles the action taken after pressing the customers button. The customersView.fxml is loaded
        Parameters:
        event - The action event.

      • handleReportsButton

        private void handleReportsButton​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
        This method handles the action taken after pressing the reports button. The reportsView.fxml is loaded
        Parameters:
        event - The action event.

      • setUser

        public void setUser​(User user)
        This method receives an User object from the previous scene and sets it as the User object for this scene.
        Parameters:
        user - The user passed from the previous scene.

      • handleClose

        private void handleClose​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
        This method handles the action to take after the close menu item is pressed.
        Parameters:
        event - The action event
